result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward William Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edward William Price is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Edward William Price was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus costs, DNA surcharge and disbursements.  To be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result  in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
AODA assesment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample it previously provided.
The Court advised defendasnt that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; and further advised of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to:  Department of Corrections, Attn:  Records, 2909 E. Park Avenue, Chippewa Falls, WI  54729
Order to effectuate change from Confinement to Extended Supervision signed and filed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 38, Judge Wagner.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 19, 2015 received and filed.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1177.50 entered as ordered by the court on03/26/15 to pay $100.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 03/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.
WCS report received and filed.
WCS report received and filed.  Defendant compliant.
Defendant appeared in person to obtain new court date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Defendant provided copy of same.

Branch 20 will not be in session on 2/06/15.  Case is rescheduled for plea and sentencing before Branch 20 on 2/19/15 at 8:30 a.m.  Attorney Hart notified that his client must appear on or before 2/06/15 to sign off on the Agreed Upon Request Form.
Branch 20 now not in session.  Parties select 2/06/15 at 8:30 a.m.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Edward William Price in court with Attorney Richard Hart for Attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Defendant compliant with monitoring.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward William Price in court with attorney Richard H. Hart appeared on behalf of Eric Richard Hart.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial (defendant also commencing a new treatment program).    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All conditions of bail remain.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
/from WCS, received and filed. Defendant is compliant.

Defendant Edward William Price in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court that his client is now enrolled in treatment and requested an adjournment.  Court granted defense request as the State had no objection.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from WCS, received and filed.

Defense counsel's request that the SCRAM monitoring be removed, due to defendant's monitoring on probation.  State takes no position.  Defense counsel should contact probation agent, WCS and draft order regarding same.

Defendant Edward William Price in court with attorney Eric R Hart.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from WCS, received and filed.

Defendant Edward William Price in court with attorney Eric R Hart.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from WCS, filed.
/from WCS, received and filed. rn
/Appointing Attorney at County Expense, signed and filed. rn

Defendant Edward William Price in court.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Indigency hearing proceeds.  Defendant sworn for testimony.  Court concurs that the defendant does not qualify for Public Defender appointment.  The Court hereby appoints Attorney Richard H. Hart and Attorney Eric Hart, to represent this defendant.  Court ordered defense counsel to be paid at the rate of $75.00 per hour.  Defendant would pay $100.00 per month to reimburse Milwaukee County to commence on the first day of each month upon conclusion of the case until paid in full.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and ordered case continued for preliminary hearing before Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant REFERRED TO WCS for supervision upon leaving court if they are eligible for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program. ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers. IF THEY FAIL TO REPORT TO WCS A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Edward William Price in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 20.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/27/14 @ 1:30pm
